abstract: While rights groups called Col. Mummar el-Qaddafi's death in custody under murky circumstances a potential war crime, some Arab journalists and bloggers reminded their readers that the Libyan dictator's end was similar to the fate suffered by two notorious European leaders, Benito Mussolini and Nicolae Ceausescu.
snippet: While rights groups called Col. Mummar el-Qaddafi's death in custody under murky circumstances a potential war crime, some Arab journalists and bloggers reminded their readers that the Libyan dictator's end was similar to the fate suffered by two...

headline.main: Display of Qaddafi's Body Recalls Treatment of Mussolini and Ceausescu After Death
